meanings.sent1: After the party, only a few guests were remanning in the house.
meanings.sent2: The students decided to reman in the classroom for extra help with their homework.
meanings.sent3: The cookies were so delicious that only crumbs were remanning on the plate.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the shadows remanned on the walls, creating a beautiful silhouette.
meanings.sent5: The lone tree remanning in the field stood tall against the wind.

meanings.definition: To continue to exist or be present
meanings.sent1: Despite the storm, the old house remanned standing strong.
meanings.sent2: The memories of her childhood reman vivid in her mind.
meanings.sent3: The aroma of the freshly baked bread remanned in the kitchen, tempting everyone.
meanings.sent4: His legacy remanned in the hearts of those he had helped throughout his life.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins remanning in the desert told stories of a forgotten civilization.

meanings.definition: To be left over or left behind
meanings.sent1: Only a few pieces of the puzzle were remanning on the table.
meanings.sent2: The last slice of pizza remanned untouched on the plate.
meanings.sent3: The lost sock was remanning in the dryer, waiting to be reunited with its pair.
meanings.sent4: The old books remanned on the dusty shelves, waiting for someone to discover them.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house had furniture remanning inside, covered in dust and cobwebs.
